description: Coefficient triangle of generalized Laguerre polynomials n!*L(n,2,x) (rising powers of x).
comments: The row polynomials s(n,x) := n!*L(n,2,x)= sum(a(n,m)*x^m,m=0..n) have e.g.f. exp(-z*x/(1-z))/(1-z)^3. They are Sheffer polynomials satisfying the binomial convolution identity s(n,x+y) = sum(binomial(n,k)*s(k,x)*p(n-k,y),k=0..n), with polynomials p(n,x)= sum(|A008297(n,m)|*(-x)^m, m=1..n), n >= 1 and p(0,x)=1 (for Sheffer polynomials see A048854 for S. Roman reference).This unsigned matrix is embedded in the matrix for n!*L(n,-2,-x). Introduce 0,0 to each unsigned row and then add 1,-1,1 to the array as the first two rows to generate n!*L(n,-2,-x). - _Tom Copeland_, Apr 20 2014
links: Index entries for sequences related to Laguerre polynomials
formula: a(n, m) = ((-1)^m)*n!*binomial(n+2, n-m)/m!.E.g.f. for m-th column sequence: ((-x/(1-x))^m)/(m!*(1-x)^3), m >= 0.n!*L(n,2,x) = (n+2)!*hypergeom([-n],[3],x)/2. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 08 2015
maple: with(PolynomialTools):p := n -> (n+2)!*hypergeom([-n],[3],x)/2:seq(CoefficientList(simplify(p(n)), x), n=0..9); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 08 2015
prog: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(((-1)^k)*n!*binomial(n+2, n-k)/k!, ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 06 2014
crossrefs: For m=0..5 the (unsigned) columns give A001710, A005990, A005461, A062193-A062195. The row sums (signed) give A062197, the row sums (unsigned) give A052852.
